content.description: Dark featured corner at the left-most area on the crag (Downriver/South end). Crux at start just left of large beautiful fragrant sage bush (cough). I think this is a good first sport lead.   The hardest move is right off the ground.
content.location: First (most left or downstream) climb on lower tier of Utopia.

content.description:
The slab at the start is the crux. Great climbing above on good solid basalt.  

The trail descends and several longer climbs (70 to 90 ft) line this section
content.protection:
Eight clips will get you to a two bolt anchor.  

  Start down and right of Nirvana Blues. 

  One of the best routes at the crag.

content.description: Start on first two bolts of Nirvana Blues and move right to thin face and then arÃªte.  Nice rest below final bolt on buldge.  Turn roof on large reachy holds to 2 ring anchor at ledge.
Ramifications.  Caution loose rock below and through roof.  Needs cleaning.
Continouos sequences to rest mid route then jugs to chains.
content.protection: Bolts to Anchor for Writing Down the Bones
content.location: Second route on lower tier, great movement on nice rock.

climbs.name: The Sterile Cuckoo
climbs.fa: Bob D,  Mike Howard and Thor Husted

content.description: Cool climbing up into a weird crux sequence.
content.protection: Ten bolts lead to a two bolt anchor. Use long runners on the fourth and fifth bolt.

content.description: The crux is the crackless corner.   Great route on iron hard basalt.
content.protection: Three clips and small gear to medium gear for the upper corner. Rap from the anchor.
content.location: Start around corner at end of ledge.  Shared start and then trend left to trad corner.

content.description:
Second Route on the lower tier.  Bouldery start up to shallow crack leads to technical crux.  Continue the pump on pockets to the chains.  "Yes we can!" 

First set of climbs of the main wall. #1Bones then Stimulus Package then #2 Obamanos.  Rest are in order.
content.protection:
Bolts to sport anchor.  Please top rope off your own draws. 

  Anchors accessible for top rope - traverse from top of 5.7 or reach anchors from top

content.description: A pumpy crux finish. Great climbing on solid basalt.
content.protection: Six clips will get you to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Start as for 'On the Mesa". Clip the first bolt then angle right and up the steep feature face.

content.description:
Amazing climbing up to and over a six foot overhang. Some loose holds may persist. The climbing above the overhang is excellent. Stick clip the first bolt and then do hard moves up the thin seam. The crux is moving right from the layback to below the roof. 

  Maybe the longest and therefore one of the best route at the crag.
content.protection: Ten clips will get you to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The route lies down and right of Nirvana Blues. You can't miss it.

content.description:
Share start and first 2 bolts with Wizard of Loneliness and then follow bolt line straight up through roof (crux) to short fist sized crack.  2 Bolt anchor.  Please leave biners. 

  New route, could still have loose holds. 

Another classic novel by John Nichols(American_writer)
content.protection: 6 bolts to wide crack (Used Gold and Blue Camalot but also takes smaller pro (~0.5-1 inch)inside the wider crack.
content.location: Between Wizard of Loneliness and The Sterile Cuckoo.

content.description: Good route with mix of bolts and gear.
content.protection: Gear to a blue camalot for the start and quickdraws for the upper face.

content.description: Obvious dark, blocky trad line on Sterile Cuckoo face.
content.location: First crack after walking down to lower level.

content.description: Entrance to Lower Tier is from the south down Black Mamba wash. The first short wall has a  nice concentration of sport and sport/trad routes. The first route is  a  5.7 warm up. If you wish to toprope, it is possible to traverse to set up top ropes or drop in from boulders above.  Lower level has long wall with series of nice, varied climbs
